page.title: 10The Cattle Ring.
page.content: The weight was then chalked on a board for everybody to see.Farmers bid on the cattle they want and the auctioneer takes the bids quickly.When there are no more bids the auctioneer bangs his hammer and the steer is sold.The buyer's name is recorded and sent up to the office on a pulley. The selling is very noisy and everything moves very quickly.A team of men help to put the cattle into the ring and to get them out after they have been sold. The auctioneer's name was Mr. Leslie Thomas .There were 61 cattle for sale today but as three were rejected only 58 sales went through.563 sheep were for sale 10 of which were rejects. Mr. Thomas has no connection with the McCartneys,a family concern in Craven Arms for many years.
